9. Compensation
(a) In consideration of the rights granted by Individual hereunder, Lifeway agrees
to pay Individual a royalty (the "Royalty") equal to $0.02 for each Lifeway product or
individual item sold by Lifeway during each calendar month of the Term bearing
Individual's first name, last name or other identifying personal characteristics;
provided, however, the Royalty will cease being paid upon the death of Individual.
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Royalty will not exceed $50,000
in any month. All undisputed Royalty payments shall be made in U.S. dollars in cash or
to the order of Individual and shall be due and payable within thirty (30) days after
the end of each calendar month for sales during the previous month.
perturbation.changed_text:
9. Compensation
(a) In consideration of the rights granted by Individual hereunder, Lifeway agrees
to pay Individual a royalty (the "Royalty") equal to $0.02 for each Lifeway product or
individual item sold by Lifeway during each calendar month of the Term bearing
Individual's first name, last name or other identifying personal characteristics;
provided, however, the Royalty will cease being paid upon the death of Individual.
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Royalty will not exceed $50,000
in any month. All undisputed Royalty payments shall be made in U.S. dollars in cash or
to the order of Individual and shall be due and payable within sixty (60) days after
the end of each calendar month for sales during the previous month.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction regarding the payment deadline for royalties. Initially, payments are due within 30 days after the end of each calendar month, now it's changed to 60 days. This introduces ambiguity about the correct payment timeline, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Confidentiality - With respect to this Agreement and any information supplied in
connection with this Agreement and designated by the disclosing party as confidential,
the recipient agrees to: (i) protect the confidential information in a reasonable and
appropriate manner; (ii) use confidential information only to perform its obligations
under this Agreement; and (iii) reproduce confidential information only as required to
perform its obligations under this Agreement. This section shall not apply to
information that is: (i) publicly known; (ii) already known to the recipient; (iii)
disclosed to a third party without restriction; (iv) independently developed; or (v)
disclosed pursuant to legal requirement or order.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Confidentiality - With respect to this Agreement and any information supplied in
connection with this Agreement and designated by the disclosing party as confidential,
the recipient agrees to: (i) protect the confidential information in a commercially reasonable manner; (ii) use confidential information only to explore potential business opportunities; and (iii) reproduce confidential information only with prior written consent of the disclosing party. This section shall not apply to
information that is: (i) publicly known; (ii) already known to the recipient; (iii)
disclosed to a third party without restriction and without prior written consent of the disclosing party; (iv) independently developed; or (v)
disclosed pursuant to legal requirement or order.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces contradictions within the confidentiality clause. The standard of care for protecting confidential information changes from 'reasonable and appropriate' to 'commercially reasonable'. Furthermore, the permitted use of confidential information expands to include exploring potential business opportunities, conflicting with the original restriction to only performing obligations under the agreement. The condition of the third party information disclosure is also changed by adding the requirement of prior written consent. This creates uncertainty about the scope and limitations of confidentiality.

perturbation.original_text:
12. Assignment - Neither party will assign any of its rights or obligations under this
Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party, such consent not to be
unreasonably, conditioned, withheld or delayed.
perturbation.changed_text:
12. Assignment - Neither party will assign any of its rights or obligations under this
Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Lifeway may assign this agreement to any of its subsidiaries without consent.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence grants Lifeway the right to assign the agreement to its subsidiaries without needing Individual's consent, contradicting the initial statement that 'Neither party will assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party'. This creates an in-text contradiction regarding the assignment clause, causing ambiguity about whether Individual's consent is actually required in all assignment scenarios.
